text: Rekomendasi Villa terbaik di daerah Selong Belanak. Pemandangan sekitar dikelilingi hamparan bukit dan laut, sangat indah. Bangunannya unik dan mewah. Pelayanannya sangat baik, semua staff ramah. Utk tipe Heavenly Haven (presidential suite), kamarnya nyaman dan kamar mandi cukup luas dilengkapi bathtub. Dari kamar viewnya langsung menghadap bukit dan laut. Utk tipe Tree Haven (dgn kolam renang pribadi), kamar dengan bathtub yang viewnya langsung pemandangan. Luar biasa sekali rasanya saat bangun tidur langsung bisa menikmati pemandangan alam. Apalagi saat cuaca cerah, pemandangan sunsetnya menakjubkan dilihat dari Seven Havens. Sarapannya enak, terutama buah yang disantap bersama yoghurt. Terimakasih banyak Pak Wawan dan Ibu Wulan, pengalaman menginap di Seven Havens tak terlupakan ❤️

text:
We stayed at the Valley view villa for 4 night. The villa itself is amazing, the views are gorgeous! We really left all our troubles behind waking up to the expansive view of the mountain, valley and palm trees, as well as to the sounds of the village and countryside. 
The private pool had sparkling clean water and it was a real treat to be able to hop in any time of day! 
It was just a short stroll to Selong Belanak Beach, which was one of the best beaches we have ever been to. 

As many people have already commented, the staff at Seven Havens are simply THE BEST. Julia, Heru and Sam made us feel so welcomed and looked after at all times. They were accomodating, helpful and so friendly. 

There are plenty of wildlife around the villa, such as geckos and lizards on the walls. These are to be expected in a natural environment where the villa is located, and is all party of the experience. My partner also kept reminding me that they are harmless and actually “rather cute” in his terms. 
I have a real phobia of lizards and though I did suffer a few scares, overall I still really enjoyed my time at Seven Havens! 

We would definitely recommend Seven Havens, because everything was simply wonderful.
title: Beautiful villa with wonderful people

text:
We stayed just for one night in the 360 degrees room - this place and its location is simply fabulously breath-taking! We skipped our hotel in west Lombok at Sengiggi in order to stay here and we were not disappointed.  Julia speaks unbelievably good English and we enjoyed talking to the chef/waiter called Hero who cooked us supper which we ate at a table set up for us next to the gorgeous infinity pool.  This place is definitely worth seeking out - the views are spectacular and we spent part of the day at Selong Balanak beach where we had lunch at the lovely Sempiak Villas restaurant on the beach.  A wonderful experience for us and a cherished memory of the lovely island of Lombok. 
Note for Julia: I managed to find the shop that sold the lovely refreshment napkins (in Seminyak on our return to Bali - it's called Pure Napkins) - I tracked down the Frangipani essential oil and bought enough of the bamboo-fibre napkins and the little bamboo holders for the napkins and the essential oils to last a lifetime of impressing guests with a beautifully scented refreshment wipe.  Thank you for a wonderful time! It was absolutely magical - seeing the lit-up fishing boats at night time from our room is something I will always remember - we wish you every success - you deserve it !! Sharon and Dave from England
title: Wow - what an amazing place !

text:
We are good friends of the owners, and had the chance to stay with them on multiple occasions at Seven Havens. To us, it is a little paradise they have built here. We loooove to sit on the terrace, in the bar lounge or chill at the edge of the infinity pool at any time of the day and soak in the incredible view. You won't ever get enough of it! 
The rooms are spacious, modern & light, with huge panorama windows so that you can continue to enjoy the views from your nicely air conditioned room. All rooms are beautiful, but our favorites are The Residence (of course!), Haven of Serenity, and the more recently built Valley View Haven. What we also love is that although there are 5 rooms/residences in total, it never feels crowded. The layout of the place is such that there are enough private areas for all guests to enjoy a tranquil afternoon on the terrace and/or by the pool (Valley View Haven even has its own little plunge pool).
The Seven Havens Residence staff are amazing, lovely, honest and caring people. Just tell them what you would like, and they'll try to make it happen.  
Selong Belanak beach is in walking distance (check out Laut Biru beach restaurant/club) but the Seven Havens' staff will be happy to drive you down quickly by car or motorbike if needed (and will pick you up again later) as well. 
We can't wait to go back again to Seven Havens!! It is one of the most beautiful serene spots on earth we have been to (and we travel a lot both for business and leisure!). You will love it!! Remember to book early though ;-)
title: Paradise!!!!!!!

text:
This nicely designed villa complex is located up on a hilltop. It actually consists of 1 private villa and 1 larger villa that can be booked per-room or whole. 

The large villa has a beautiful view of selong belanak beach. The private villa which we booked, had a view of the hills. But had its own private pool, a big plus plus 👍. The room was very spacious with large view windows, had a large patio where we had our meals.

Ms Yulia and her staff were great. Treated us very well, made us feel right at home.

But, be cautious when leaving food around the villa. Because you might get a visit from a family of monkeys, which happened to us also. It was a good thing their staff had given us a heads up.

text: My siblings and I stayed here for 3 nights because of the views, and it was worth it! The room was beautiful. Waking up and seeing such beauty through our glass room walls, enjoying it while having breakfast in the common room, then all day by or in the pool - it was a perfect way to unwind and get over the jet lag. There are only 3 rooms, so if they are not filled with large noisy families, the place is perfect. Julia was very helpful with everything, including getting me a local carrier SIM card, and all the staff is wonderful. Breakfast was included in the room rate, and other meals were made to order. They were quite good, but took a long time, so we adjusted by placing orders ahead of time. They also drove us to the beach on scooters and came to pick us up at set time. The only things that need improvement were unreliable hot water, and the towels did not smell fresh.
title: Stunning place

Dear Ms Kateryna, 
On behalf of all staff I would like to thank you for your kind review and compliments, we are trying our best to make our guests satisfied and happy with our service. For a small place we are taking pride in providing only fresh food prepared from the scratch, hence it took sometime to deliver it. We thank you for your understanding and ordered in advance. The hot water situation has been improved and we have changed the boiler. I will personally check with the staff about the towel, as this was never happen before. Again thank you for writing this review and hopefully one day we will be able to welcoming you again in Seven Haven Residence.
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
Starting with pros: as others already mentioned by others there are magnificent views, the pool is amazing, the design and layout, and the staff were great, especially the lady who was running the villa. Also free transports to the beach, good breakfasts and dinners (fairly priced, plenty of supporting information and least but not last our pet frog who close to our 2 apartments the whole time.

Now on the downside, some minor observations which I wouldn't probably even note if this was a medium or budget level lodging. Cleaning could be better, we found several spider webs in one of our apartments. TVs in both apartments didn't work at the check in, however this problem was solved immediately after notification and in 1 apartment there was no hot water (guess the boiler didn't work), but this was not an issue since we showered in the other one. Soundproofing also wasn't perfect, which seems to be the norm in Indonesia (those motorcycles all seem to take the exhaust systems off).

All in all a great stay, with minor inconveniences which I am sure will be improved, since they are in the business for 1 year only so far.
title: Spectacular views, great staff but some rooms for improvement

text: It was a family (of 8) trip, we rented the whole villa. We had 2 teenager boys (4 of us), my sister and her 3 yr old boy, my brother, and my mother. Everyone enjoyed being at Seven Havens. Selong Beach was also very very nice, our boys loved that beach.

text:

The absolute highlight is the infinity pool which was surely the best we had seen traveling through Asia. The view to the beach, especially for dusk and dawn was spectacular.
Service is top notch, everybody is more than friendly and really trying the make your stay perfect. They have somebody around 24h a day, even taking care of any animals getting too close to the Villa. They even do you laundry for free. 
Overall, highly recommended and would go there again anytime!

text:
One of the best villas I've been ever stay.

Me and some friends stayed at Seven Havens and choose the best room which is a Heavenly Havens, and my choice is the best! Huge room, with two floors. The view from the top of the room is very surreal .. Can you imagine when you woke up, you see the view of the rice fields and the ocean directly from your room?

The Infinity Pool is also our favorite place to relax. The concept of this villa is very friendly, we can even freely interact with other visitors (there are communal areas) that can be used to spend time together. Julia, the manager of Seven Havens is also very friendly and helpful. She chatted with us and recommend some places we wanted to visit.

various Western Food, makes me even confused to choose. So good!

Transport is also easy, because there is a shuttle that can take us back to Mataram. The distance is relatively close to the tourist destinations, making Seven Haven has a strategic location to stay.

In conclusion, I highly recommend Seven Havens during my holiday in Lombok. Hopefully there's another chance to come back here.

text:
I stayed in the Heavenly Haven apartment which was just wonderful. This place should be called Seven Heavens! Although there were some little 'imperfections', the manager's passion for making guests happy, the stunning villa and design, and the location made up for all of them. Just briefly on the few things that could be improved: 
The shower - the boiler switches off constantly - the villa is located quite high up the hill and the wind seems to be the culprit here. In 9 days I stayed there, I could never run hot water for longer than maybe 1 minute before I had to close the shower and open it again to get more hot water. The wind makes this place so pleasant and breezy on the other hand that even in the Lombok heat, you can bear it easily.

Lack of a wardrobe / full body-size mirror.

Although the place is generally very clean and still new, there are nooks and crannies that could be kept cleaner such as the glass area around the planters in the bathroom in Heavenly Haven, the floor in the shower or the surface around the washbasin during our stay.

I have to highlight the fact we enjoyed our 9-day stay at 7 Havens thoroughly, and on top of all the wonderful villa, its location and the atmosphere, here are a few delighters:
- consistently prompt service from Julia, the manager, every time we needed something - whether it was a question or food (they provided a bell for our apartment so that you we didn't have to look for a member of staff or use a phone)
- Drop offs and pickups to the beach and other local attractions any time of the day. So helpful!
- Help with getting medicines from Kuta, sparkling wine (no alcohol on the menu), or a nail polish remover!
- Free of charge daily laundry service - just brilliant!
- Nice staff - although there was a language barrier, they were a very lovely bunch 
- Very welcoming and accommodating attitude 
- The location and the villa: this place is so relaxing ... the design of the villa, the amount of thought and effort put in every detail of its interiors, furnishings, the pool, of course, is just unbelievable. There is a nice local spa and you must try Aura, the lounge and bar nearby.
I fell in love with this place before I even got there but it also exceeded my expectations in many ways.

text:
This place was a bit of a wild card, and I am beyond glad that I randomly stumbled upon this place while doing my vacation planning, as it ended up being a highlight of our trip. Lombok, Selong Belanak is a truly special place, and is currently the perfect place to visit, because it has local culture and unspoiled beauty, that has not been spoilt by tourism. On the other hand, there are a few great restaurants, that are top notch. So, at this moment, it is a dream vacation destination, one I am dying to go back to. 

Seven haven is a great location, and the view simply can not be beat. Waking up to the unreal view, with the beautiful Muslim prayer serenading in the back ground, then followed by a brilliant breakfast, while watching monkeys play is hard to top. The beach nearby is also exquisite, and barely trickled with people, so great. Although we are not surfers, we played in the waves for hours, with intermitant stops for cocktails at the restaurant. 

Sam, the driver for the villa, truly made our stay unforgettable! He arranged a great day of site seeing, took us to restaurants, and ensured we were able to experience the beautiful local culture.Sam, was one of the kindest, and most welcoming people we have ever met. He did not let the language barrier prevent us from communicating, he used google translator, which allowed us to get to know him better. Our group of four, all loved Sam and are forever thankful for the experiences he shared with us. He stopping to let is met  local farmers, pet water buffalo, local beaches, it was all amazing! Julia, the manager, and the other staff members were also beyond kind and went out of the way to ensure we had a great stay. We loved the staff, and much appreciated how welcoming they were. 

I will note, that we had a few hiccups at the start of our trip, as some special anniversary arrangments were not fulfilled, in fact, the place did nothing for the special occasion. Although I never wish anything complimentary, I had tried pre-arranging some things, to be paid for,  and it fell through. However, despite my initial frustrations, the owner acknowledged it, and helped to resolve the issue, and the rest of our stay exceeded our expectations. We ended up loving everything about our stay, and felt the staff made it extra special. If you are on the fence, go!! You will love Lombok, and Seven Haven definitely has the best view. 

A few side notes, we rented the whole place out, I suggest doing this if you can, or if you have a group, as the communal areas are not huge, and you will enjoy having the entire space. Or if you have 3 couples, this place is ideal!!  All the rooms are very nice, however the top high room is the biggest, and has a great room and a private patio. We were happy with all three rooms. The other thing to note, is wine, beer, and liquor is hard to get in Lombok. I knew this ahead of time, yet did not go about it correctly. If you enjoy a few cocktails, do yourself a favor and prepare accordingly. You can bring a bottle per person from Bali, or I suggest you let Julia know in advance, and she could most likely pick up some wine, beer, or whatever when she is in town and have it there for you, and you could prepay, or pay on arrival. The restaurants do have a nice variety, however we wanted to enjoy wine while relaxing at the private pool. Beer can be purchased from restaurants to-go,  yet keep in mind we never found any at stores. Julia, went above and beyond to ensure we had what we needed, however in the future I would bring from Bali to avoid the hassle. 

Again, This place is incredible and Lombok has stole all of our hearts. There are few places that ever make the repeat list, yet we will surely be back to Lombok, and Seven Haven specifically.

text:
Teetering high above the road just inland from Selong Balanak is this 3 unit villa with private lap pool, amazing views and sunset that took our breath away.

It is a 45 degree hill to climb home to but so close the the beach it was worth it.

Julia manages the property and was there for our check in and arranged our transport from the Praya airport to 7 Havens (~$10-15 USD), about 30 min drive. You could get dinner any time you indicated a few hours before.  The menu was negotiable and the food was artfully presented.  We dined alone in a pretty room with great views.  Breakfast was included.  Dinner was additional but very reasonably priced  (~$30 for 3 of us --local chicken dish and sides).

They arranged a driver for us to go explore all the area beaches (Mawan, Kuta, Tanjung Aan) and have dinner one night in Kuta at the Sofitel.

They advertise that you can get spa services nearby at Sempiak Villas but they were booked up when we tried to use them.  Disappointing.

The furnishings are modern with fun twists (like a big round bathtub that felt like swimming in a soup bowl.

I would recommend this for a very special experience.  Selong was our favorite beach so there was no need to roam.

Driver did not speak English but was very jovial and it wasn't really difficult to get where we needed to go.
title: Extremely memorable property and personal service

text:
Last time I was in Lombok, I spotted a cool looking villa on the way to Selong Belanak beach and knew I'd have to visit in the future. So, when a friend and I wanted a weekend escape from Jakarta, I knew it was time to visit Seven Havens. It lived up to all my expectations and more!

From the minute we arrived, the manager, Julie, made us feel welcome. The villa is small - only three rooms, so it often feels like you have the entire place to yourself. The additional staff are around when you need them, but mostly stay away from the main areas of the villa, which I really appreciated as it allowed us privacy. If you do need anything, all you need to do is push the button on a remote and within seconds someone is there to help you. 

Now, what really is amazing about this place is the view. Every single room has a different view, but all are breathtaking. You can tell a lot of thought went into the design of the villa. You must catch at least one sunset from the pool - absolutely stunning! It is so easy to stay in the pool all day and take in the views of the beach and surrounding mountains. 

Our flight on Sunday didn't leave until 8pm, but because no one had reserved the room for Sunday, we were allowed to have the room until 6.30pm free of charge. It allowed us one more full day in the pool, beach and time to shower before heading back to Jakarta. 

If you want a place to relax with stunning views, check this place out!
title: One of the best views in Lombok!

We booked out the entire residence and I can say it is well worth it. If you're looking for a secluded luxury villa in Lombok then you've found it. 

Perched on top of an already elevated hill, you are presented with an uninterrupted view towards the beach and ocean and it's surroundings. 

Enjoy a drink by or in the infinity pool as you watch the sunset over the mountains. Alternatively you can enjoy the sunset from the comfort of your bed. 

The full-time staff here looked after us very well. We woke up whenever we felt like it and proceeded to order or breakfast. On our last night we gave the staff some money to buy seafood and had it cooked by the pool on the barbeque. Be sure to try the fried banana for the sweet tooth out there. 

Ensure you spend a day by the beach where you can rent bean bags or sun lounges. The sand is nice and soft here. We went in the late afternoon, about 3:30pm and stayed until the sunset. 

I'd gladly return here when work permits again. A great place to unwind and recoup in private.

text:
The Heavenly Haven suite has modern yet warm and cozy design. It features a private lounge with high-speed Internet access, cable television and DVD player. Going up to the upper level, you will enter capacious sleeping quarters with majestic views all around. Space is equipped with a large and comfortable bed, roomy closet and large mirror. There is a private terrace with sunbeds where you can relax in the sunshine, without being disturbed. The terrace is onlooking the most spectacular landscape and lush infinity pool. The lavish bathroom offers spacious bath for two and separate modern shower. 
Spacious semi-outdoor living space is right beside the swimming pool, shared with two other suits. Equipped with a cooker, fridge, large preparation area, dining table and also a cozy sofa with coffee table. Large windows provide natural light and a glorious view. Staff of Seven Heaven offered excellent customer service. Upon my arrival, I was welcomed with a personalized letter from the Manager – Wawan. I was also served an ice tea and pisang goreng, a fried banana coated in batter. I felt well looked after, but never disturbed. Personnel can be contacted by WhatsApp and is always ready to assist. 

Overall, my stay at Seven Havens was the one of the best ones in Indonesia. Highly recommended!

If you’re looking for accommodations that provide a breathtaking view, comfortable, spacious & clean rooms with great service then look no further when staying near Selong Belanak.

I suggest you provide a tip at the end of your stay if you avail of this wonderful service. They also provide free laundry service so that you don’t have to travel with dirty laundry or can pack lightly if you reuse the same clean clothes for your next travel destination from Lombok. text:
We decided to stay at Seven Havens Resort to wind down and relax as well as exploring the beaches of Selong Belanak. We couldn't have chosen a more heavenly place!

Perched on the hillside with breathtaking views of the coconut palms, local life and Selong Belanak beach below, the location couldn't be more perfect and just a 10 minute walk to access the beach.

We stayed in the brand new 'Tree Haven' villa for the first two nights and experienced secluded paradise with stunning views of local Lombok from our infinity pool. The terrace is spacious to lounge, eat breakfast to the sound of the jungle below and a soundsystem to play music. The pool is simply amazing, seemlessly floating above the trees.

Housed below is the fresh and luxurious bedroom, kitchenette and bathroom, all fixtures and fittings brand new, to the highest quality and luxurious. The bed is super comfy.

Our next three nights were spent in the main complex in the Presidential Suite. A Presedential suite with a Presedential view of the tobacco and rice fields below with the full stretch of Selong Belanak in the distance.

We enjoyed the unique shipping container design of the suite with a spacious and comfy lounge area below and the suite above. The bath tub was the biggest we've ever seen! The suite also has a private sundeck overlooking the infinity pool and views for days. The room itself built into the shipping container had a lot of character and was very fresh, luxurious and airy.

We enjoyed the lounge area to make early morning coffee, read a book against the backdrop of the coconut fields and store our food and drink.

The infinity pool was just a sight to behold with one of the best views we have experienced from an infinity pool. Sweeping views of the tobacco fields, local Lombok farmers tending to their crops, swaying palm trees and of course turquoise blues of the ocean and misty mountains in the distance. Swimming on cloud 9.

For an exclusive, unique escape in the hills of Lombok, Seven Havens really is seventh heaven.
title: A heavenly, secluded escape in the hillside of South of Lombok

We stayed in Valley View for three nights and overall had a great stay.   Staff were really friendly, especially Randy and Hero.  We were offered a lift whenever we went out - either on the back of a scooter or in the car if it was available. 

Breakfast was very tasty - we had spicy Nasi Goreng each day (by choice).  

A few things could make Seven Havens even better
- we had arranged an airport transfer, which was good and quite reasonable, but our room wasn’t ready when we arrived so we had to wait in the heat for about an hour. However we were given a cold drink.  
- despite being quite new, the Valley View room already needs some maintenance as looking a bit tired in some parts
- there was no information available about nearby restaurants, things to do, trips that could be arranged
- I think we could have had dinner in the breakfast area if we wanted, but no information was provided

We did go on a half day trip, but the driver didn’t speak good English and basically just took us to see some beaches and into Kuta - it was good but could have been a lot better.  

Overall we had a good stay but there could be some improvements.
title: Great stay

Thank you very much for your praise and feedback on our establishment. Please allow us to apologize for any inconvenience caused during your stay in Seven Havens. We would like to explain further on your comments as follow: 

- Our check in time is always indicated very clearly at 2 pm and any guests who were arrived early we are more than welcome to let them sit inside the lounge area near swimming pool while waiting and served cold drinks as you stated. 

- Noted on your remark on Valley View, but I wish you were a bit specific in your remark. We are always, continuously updated our accommodation in the best possible way. 

- We have dedicated villa manager who are always on site as your private concierge for all information and necessary arrangement needed for each and every guests. All the guests must do is ask :)

text:
We stayed 4 nights at this wonderful villa! The views are magical, and you will not regret paying above Lombok prices for this place. We were lucky to book the Presidential Suite, which is a two-level flat providing land and sea views and your own patio for sun-bathing. 

No matter if you wake up, have breakfast, swim in the pool or chill on your sun loungers you will be able to enjoy the view and feel like you are in a private secluded paradise. 

Next to small but very nice touches such as free laundry service, good dinner in the residence and free unlimited Wifi (not only in the villa but everywhere you go!!), the staff and manager Julie is what make this place an absolute gem. 

Scooters are available for rent within the villa for a very reasonable price or you can ask the staff to drive you down to the local restaurants and beach. 
We highly recommend you rent the scooter and explore the area as the most beautiful beaches (Tanjung Aan & Tampah) are 15 to 45 minutes away and the best restaurants you will find in Kuta (30 Minute ride). There are no taxis available in the area. 

While we loved the place and we are aware it only has 3.5 stars we would appreciate the following to make the place even more perfect. 
- More options for breakfast, Fruits and Watermelon Juice remained the same for the entire stay, there is only honey for the pancakes (maybe get maple syrup or Nutella?) Jam was always the same. Only black tea available, no green, peppermint or smth else. 
- Serve drinks in the evening for guests enjoying the sunset. Unfortunately, only beer and soft drinks were available
- Change of beach towels at least once during the stay, they started to smell 
- The noise! Yes it can be very very loud due to the tuned scooters during rush hour in the early morning and early evening riding through the valley, the prayers from 3! Mosques in the vicinity starting at 4.30 am and lasting up to an hour on some days. 

Overall we loved our stay at Seven Haven Residence and we would definitely come back, even though we would have hoped for slightly less noise especially during the early mornings.
title: The Views……

text:
Stayed here for a week at Seven Havens. Booking the accommodation and finding out more details of the area were a breeze and emails were always replied to promptly. 

We got the Haven of Tranquillity room and had amazing views of the paddy fields and mountains. The accommodation is also perfect for star gazing. Room was perfect, spacious for 2 people and bed was very comfortable. We had some issues with the TV on the first 2 nights but it was promptly attended to by the hotel staff when we alerted them about it.

The staff at Seven Havens were superb, looked after us very well. They even knocked on our door one night when they noticed we were in but haven’t had dinner yet at 8pm! The staff were very helpful in recommending local places for us to eat at and their recommendations were always good. Julia, the manager at Seven Havens also arranged a snorkelling trip for us at Sekotong which we enjoyed so much. Really friendly staff, couldn’t have asked for better service. 

Selong Belanak is still a very remote part of the island (although this may perhaps change in a few years?) so food options were limited. One can opt for dinner at the accommodation itself though it is on the pricey side and other food options nearby are Kampung Cafe and Laut Biru. Both places have good food although after a week, food options may feel slightly limited. Breakfast at the accommodation is always nice although I would suggest rotating or changing the menu regularly as currently the breakfast menu is always the same. 

It takes a good 10-15 minutes walk to Selong Belanak beach (best beach in Lombok!) but do note that the accommodation is on a steep hill so walking down may feel a little intimidating and walking back uphill is a very steep climb. Most of the time, the staff would give us a lift by motorbike or van to the beach, Kampung Cafe or Laut Biru. Transportation to those 3 locations and the airport were complimentary. 

Overall, we had a fantastic holiday at Selong Belanak and Seven Havens. A really perfect holiday in a quieter part of Lombok, so happy to have been able to experience this!
title: Unforgettable Paradise!

text:
Some places are just better in photos. Seven Havens isn’t one of them. Perched in a magical hilltop setting, this intimate hideaway is even more stunning in real life than in pictures. The main pool area has a hypnotic view of the sea, white sand coves, and mountains as far as the eye can see. Our  Valley View villa was spacious, stylish in a pared down perfection way, and comfortable. Our private pool was refreshing and a good size for a swim, not one of those ridiculous plunge pools that are slightly bigger than a tub. The water was always refreshingly cold in our pool.  Julia, the manager, does a wonderful job getting the place running the  and making us feel at home. She was attentive, warm, and efficient. 
The WiFi was very good with the WiFi router provided. This is not to be taken for granted in these parts as poor or non existent mobile phone and WiFi reception are  the norm! 
Seven Havens has a free shuttle service to the nearby Sempiak  where you can take yoga lessons, access the beach, or dine in the waterfront restaurant. 
Seven Havens is terraced and has many stairs so it isn’t suitable for those with reduced  mobility. The food was delicious but orders did take a while to arrive, so best to order before you are well and truly hungry! Monkeys came to our veranda a few times buttered quickly shooed away. Just be sure to not leave food lying around outdoors. 
Seven Havens has raised the bar for luxury vacations in Lombok and we are so glad we got to experience its magic.
title: Simply sublime!

text:
Our stay at the Seven Havens Residence in the presidential suite was a great experience. 
Highlights of our stay include the friendly and accommodating staff, the beautiful views and the food both prepared by the staff and also in the local area. 
Breakfast is included and was absolutely delicious. It includes fruit, homemade yogurt, tea or coffee, fresh watermelon juice, toast with pineapple jam and a choice of a main including Indonesian and western options. 

The accommodation is well maintained, clean and nicely furnished. The presidential suite has views facing both the valley behind the accommodation from its bottom floor and views of the ocean and surrounding mountains from the top floor. The suite was flawless and the private sun deck was excellent. 

You can basically stay within the residence for your whole stay, the staff are availible to prepare breakfast lunch and dinner. We were very impressed with the food prepared by the staff, it was as good if not better in some cases than the other food we tried. 
The staff are very friendly always availible at the ring of a bell to answer any questions, prepare food, organise transport or anything else you need. 

If you are staying for more than a few days renting a scooter is a good idea to be able to venture out into the surrounding area, particularly the beaches along the south coast. 

There is a car and a number of scooters that the staff will use to transport you to anywhere nearby and pick you up again. The car sometimes requires a short wait if it isn't available which isn't an issue if you organise in advance. 
The staff will be able to organise transport to and from the airport. 

The beach is about a 15 minute walk away or the staff will drop you off. The beach has fairly large waves. There are a number of restraunts on the beach as well as surf board rental and lessons and other local businesses. The beachfront restruant at the Sempiak villas (where the staff will drop you) has really nice food and drinks. At a higher cost than the smaller local businesses next to it but we found ourselves going back. 

WiFi is provided via a Hotspot which was very fast and unlimited. 

The pool has stunning views, is a refreshing temperature and a nice place to hang around.
title: Stunning views and suites

text:
We stayed in the presidential suite. The views from the bedroom (and the pool) were incredible. The room was so spacious - a lounge downstairs, huge bed and bathroom upstairs.  We had a balcony with two sun loungers (we asked for an umbrella to be brought up). Staff were lovely, and they were very happy to take you wherever you liked. Beach and spa is a two minutes scooter ride. The spa was great - so peaceful and beautiful. The beach was one of the best I’ve been to - not too busy and incredible blue waters surrounded by luscious hills. 

The hotel isn’t self catered but it’s not 24/7 service either. Breakfast is served when you come down. We struggled to have lunch because the chef wasn’t always available. We had dinner once by the pool which was quite romantic, but by 9pm it was too late for dessert (except ice cream). Beers and soft drinks are limited but you can help yourself and pay when you leave (you just need to remember how many you had!). I would generally recommend eating lunch and dinner out, and we tried a few lovely places on the beach and also Kampang Cafe and Aura restaurant.

We came on our honeymoon!
title: Breathtaking views and beautiful beach

text:
Do not wait. Book this residence right now. If you are questioning it at all - please do not. It was such a wonderful part of my month long journey, I can not express my gratitude for the experience of staying here enough. Everyone, especially Julia, made it a highlight of my trip. From the scooter I rented, the beach recommendations, the day trip snorkeling in the Gili Islands, they handled everything with easy and comfort. 
Julia even introduced me to her yoga instructor - Veronika - who was simply lovely. 
Peace, quiet, amazing service in a beautiful setting. It is pure magic here.
Selong Belanak was the best beach I went to while I was visiting - quiet, great swimming, beautiful blue color. My last morning, I scooted down at 545am to witness the sunrise. Not one person on the beach with me. An experience I will never forget. 
Thank you Seven Havens.
title: YES! Do it - just GO!

text:
Our family of three (husband, 21-year old daughter and myself) just stayed two nights at this wonderful villa in South Lombok. We found Seven Havens to be a very special place. We stayed in the Havens of Tranquility room, which had plenty of room for the three of us and all our luggage. 

We loved the design of the villa, and the way recycled materials (including old shipping containers!) were used to create the well-thought out space. The villa sits atop a small hill that gives it a breathtaking view of the surrounding countryside and Selong Belanak bay beyond. 

We communicated quite extensively with the owner, Mdm. Wulan Roos, who was very responsive to our many, many questions and very accommodating when we changed our plans. All staff, especially the General Manager Ms. Julia, are thoughtful, helpful and incredibly warm people. We felt immediately at home and were well-taken care of.

We stayed in for dinner at the villa instead of going elsewhere as we read in one of the reviews that the food was delicious. It is! We loved all our well-prepared and tasty dishes. Bu Julia surprised us with some local dessert as treats. (Thank you, Bu!) 

If you want to visit the nearby Selong Belanak beach, you can either walk (10-15 minutes) or ask for the free shuttle service from the villa (5 minute drive).

Seven Havens is one of those special places that we are very lucky to have found!
title: Seven Havens is stunning and truly magical!

text:
We spent one night here unfortunately it was booked up the next. It’s a popular place so book in advance. 
We were really pleased with the room we had with amazing views. 

The staff are helpful and service is good. 
We had a lovely dinner while looking out onto the bay at night. 
The pool is breathtaking with an infinity pool going off into the jungle bellow. 
We watched monkeys as they came to drink from the pool in the afternoon. A lovely sight. 

The only problem we encountered was a few Geckos in the room, one that woke us up three times in the night very loudly. The rooms should be checked for these as just one can ruin an otherwise peaceful night. 

I would recommend this place, at least to experience the fabulous setting and views.
title: Stunning location and room with and amazing view

text: A long overdue review of the best place we've ever stayed at. It was a beautiful location that looked over the beach and the village below. Food was delicious, the villa was even better in person, and the hospitality that we were greeted with by every employee was spectacular. It was truly an experience we will never forget and we can't wait to be back when the new villa has been built! Highly highly recommend Seven Havens should you be in Lombok!

Staff...they are the cherry on top! Julia and her team were very hospitable and ensured we always had everything we needed. They  are such genuine, warm and caring people. It really felt like we were with family. Special thanks to Julia and her team...kindly sought us fresh coconut water, fresh green mangoes...all delivered to the villa....you really went out of your way to make our trip the highlight of our year. We cannot wait to visit again. 

Area...beautiful! Everyone is so so friendly. Local spa, learnt to surf locally...and stunning views at Aura as well.

Stunning view but does offer less privacy as staff and guests do pass by. Though, wasn't an issue and a good compromise for such a lovely view.  Like living in a postcard.  For exclusive privacy, the 2nd level or back room is suggested.   Both equally as breathtaking.  Look forward to returning.  Albeit better weather this time!  Thank you Seven Havens!

We are delighted with the attitude and humbleness of Mr Wulan (Owner). He we very helpful from the initial booking enquiry, planning our trip/activities in Lombok and even post cancellation.

We are so pleased that we booked with Mr Wulan, and would definitely love to stay at this place, next time we plan a trip to Lombok.

text:
We stayed in Seven Havens for four nights and wished we could have stayed longer. The view from the infinity pool is breathtaking and the hotel is very well made. The staff from the super lovely Julia to Sam the driver and Hiro (sorry for the incorrect spelling) went far beyond anything we could possibly expect and made our stay perfect. They even offered free rides within the area and had a new scooter with functioning helmets (a rarity in Lombok) waiting for us upon our arrival. The WiFi also worked really well. If we were to mention any kind of improvement a couple of additional beach chairs next to the pool could be an idea for when all three  (soon to be 4) rooms are fully booked but as we had the two storey room with a private balcony it worked well for us.

And try the banana pancakes for breakfast- you won’t regret it. We’ll definitely be back the next time we’re in Lombok.
title: Probably the best view and service in Lombok

text:
We booked all the available rooms (I think 4 rooms spread over 3 structures). Nestled on a small hill, it was very private and felt exclusive, and could have fun all night without disturbing anyone (except maybe the staff). There aren't any homes or hotels remotely close by, and at night the surroundings are pitch black. They served us seafood barbeque on the first night and it was a delicious gluttonous affair. The pool is small but overlooks a beautiful view. 

The beach is about 1-2km away though, about a 10-15 minute walk. There aren't any proper shops or restaurants nearby, the price of exclusivity I suppose.
title: Private and exclusive (if you book all the rooms)

text:
Long over due for my review, but Seven Havens has never left my mind and I meant to write since the day I left. Unfortunately when you come back to reality. Reality happens! 

My husband and I visited Lombok in August and we stayed at Seven Havens for 4 nights. We booked the room that doesn’t have the view (forget the name), and it was STILL a fantastic experience. 

Although I could write a whole essay but I’m going to keep this short and mention a few highlights which we loved: 
1) Pool/view - forever warm and the view makes you feel a million bucks. I woke up and would take a dip in the pool first thing. We would stare at the view for a long time, and we were out whenever we were back at the hotel. Although our room was lovely but the view was breathtaking. 
2) Service - Thank you Julia and Staff. Julia provided lots of tips on where to go and we always loved seeing her around, she is very fun to talk to. Staff was amazing and very friendly.
3) Food - Aaaaamazing food. You just have to try them if you’re staying there. Words cannot explain. 
4) Everything (lol) - the whole experience was just a lovely lovely experience.

We would def go back if we visit Lombok again.
title: It’s been 3 months and still on my mind

text:
Thank you Julia...... we had the most amazing week at Seven Havens staying in Haven of tranquility. The room was beautiful and the view, well just staggering! every need was seen to from transport (which is free within the local area, at anytime of day) to arranging trips, buying wine, laundry, just nothing was too much trouble. 

Selong Balanak beach is definitely the best beach on the island.  The waves were great for learning to surf and not too extreme for just swimming and having fun in them..... great little restaurant on beach and local warungs and Bbq sweet corn. Managed to have a wonderful Indonesian massage at the spa on the beach which was incredible and cost £7.00 for half an hour!  

If you want snorkelling like we did Julia organised a day trip to Pink Beach ( 2 hour journey) and a boat trip around the beaches which was great, fantastic fish and coral. Special mention to Sam our wonderful driver, so kind and his English is great! Also Herro who was happy to chat to us and share stories.... in fact all the staff and local people were really friendly. We loved seeing the naughty monkeys and hearing the local call to prayer, it became very therapeutic and we actually miss it. The noise from the motorbikes did spoil the ambience but after a couple of days you don't notice it. 

Very sad to leave but would love to come back one day and would definitely recommend for any type of holiday.... 

Q and T xxxx
title: WOW!!!!

text:
The house is an architectural wonder, with the infinity pool jutting out at a sharp angle from the top of a cliff with a breath-taking backdrop of aquamarine sea, triangular hills and a long crescent of white sand. 

Cleverly orientated, the rooms are separate pavilions clustered around the pool, and adjacent to the main living/meals pavilion. There are bright, funky bean bags and sun lounges around the deck, with plenty of shade, and the convenience of an outdoor pool shower and additional toilet. It is actually quite hard to drag oneself away from the pool area! Because the pool is unfenced and there is a steep drop-off, the house is not suitable for young children.

A staff of 13 tend to your needs: gardening, cooking, chauffeuring, cleaning and even shooing away the monkeys that tend to congregate around the pool at sunset. Julia ably hosts her guests, patiently answering questions, providing advice on local amenities and generally going out of her way to make you feel at home. She seems to appear at just the right time to help you out, and melts away unobtrusively as do the rest of the staff, giving ample privacy. She is only ever a buzz away with a handy beeper to ring should one need anything.

The rooms themselves are modern, decorated with comfortable designer furnishings and with rustic wall finishes. The air conditioning works efficiently although it struggles in the intense heat in the middle of the day, but cools off again by the time one retires. We noticed a few complaints about the hot water in some previous reviews but we never ran out of hot water and I suspect that the hot water systems have since been replaced as the units looked fairly new. Complimentary Wi-Fi was fast and in fact better than at home in Melbourne! 

Our family rented the whole accommodation of three pavilions which all have comfortable king size beds. The pavillion by the pool has a stunning bedroom vista of the beach and hills. The two-level pavillion has its own downstairs lounge with a sofa that can double as a comfortable bed, with an extra trundle mattress underneath. There is a knockout ensuite with circular bath upstairs and a private balcony with sun lounges off the bedroom, again with panoramic views. The third pavillion is set behind the pool pavillion. Although the views are not as impressive as the other accommodation, it is probably the quietest of the three rooms.

Should one dine in, the food is freshly prepared by the staff and the local
Indonesian fare was simple and delicious. We didn't try the western meals. Main courses are 65,000-100,000 IDR each (AUD 6.50-10). Breakfast offerings are western-style eggs, pancakes, Indonesian noodles or rice dishes. There is no fresh milk, yoghurt or cheese available, and honey and strawberry jam are the only toppings available. Although there is a modern kitchen in the dining pavillion, it is not well equipped. This is probably because it is so cheap to eat out and it is almost impossible to find good provisions, even in Kuta, where we were only able to source some dry goods, fresh fruit and vegetables. There is a nifty water fountain in the meals area that dispenses an unending supply of chilled water or hot water for tea and coffee; a godsend.

Note: we did one trip to Kuta and the beach didn't compare to the gorgeous local Selong Belanak beach, although Kuta offers a more diverse range of cafes, restaurants and bars.

Although only a brisk 10 minute walk to the beach, the property is on a very steep hill and therefore the staff are happy to drop you off and pick you up at the beach or local restaurants.

Wild monkeys tend to congregate at the pool around sunset which is very entertaining, although they can be very persistent if they see or smell food. If they bother you the staff are always on hand to scare them away. 

Our only real concern was the noise. Due to its elevated position one can hear mopeds, boat engines and the call to prayer from several mosques. I would therefore advise bringing earplugs for a good night's sleep!
title: t's all about the Pool!

text:
I went to Lombok on a social mission, to set up three small libraries nearby Mount Rinjani. After 4 days working far away from the city (it took 3 hours from the airport), I felt that I deserved an indulgence before going back to Jakarta. Seven Havens, a new place not far from the airport was the best choice. I don't have to go far to Senggigi beach to relax and rejuvenate.

Seven Havens is a small, luxurious villa with a very beautiful natural scenery anyone could imagine. It's the best getaway place if you want to experience tranquility and intimate service from the staffs. The residence is only consist of 3 rooms, there is no way you'll be neglected. You'll be the center of the universe. 

I would suggest you really plan and communicate to them on your inquiry when booking a reservation. For example, if you need a spa, massage, or hair stylist coming to the villa. They can work on it for you. When I stayed there, there was a guest from Switzerland who's crazy about jackfruit. Ms. Julia, the villa manager went to Mataram city and shopped the fruit only for him. 

In a way I also felt at home. Arriving late lunch time, I asked for a menu. The staff said, "no menu is here yet but we have shrimp, chicken, beef. We have our chef staying here, how do you want them to be cooked?". The approach and warmness are like we're home. Love it!

You'll get a chance to see grey monkey in surrounding area, please don't feed the monkeys. Otherwise they'll come back often and ask for more foods.

I would recommend this place for you who want valuable moments of tranquility, whether for yourself, with your partner, or with your family.
title: A day of indulgence

text:
Wir waren 4 Nächte im Seven havens und waren rundum begeistert. Wir hatten eine Poolvilla und es fehlte wirklich an nichts. Der Service im Seven havens ist phänomenal, die Mitarbeiter sind unglaublich freundlich und erfüllen jeden Wunsch. Highlight war der kostenlose Wäscheservice, den wir zwei mal genutzt haben. Das Frühstück war sehr ansprechend, man kann jeden Tag für den Folgetag wählen, was man möchte. Auch lunch und diner kann man zu beliebiger Zeit im Hotel einnehmen. 
Es gibt einen kostenfreien Shuttle zum Selong Belanak Beach (für uns der schönste Strand im Süden von Lombok). 
Ab und an hatten wir Besuch von Affen in unserem Poolbereich, die Mitarbeiter kümmern sich jedoch sofort, sollte man sich dadurch nicht wohl fühlen. 

Alles in allem ist diese Unterkunft ohne Einschränkungen weiterzuempfehlen, wir würden jederzeit wiederkommen. Wir hatten unfassbar coole 4 Tage im Seven havens!
title: 1 mit Stern

text:
Nous avons séjourné 3 nuits dans la villa Tree Haven mi-mai 2022 et nous sommes ravis de ce séjour. L'endroit est magique avec des vues exceptionnelles sur la mer et la campagne de jour comme de nuit, avec la centaine de petits bateaux de pêcheurs éclairés dans la baie.
L'hébergement est également très confortable. Les petits déjeuners sont très bons et inclus dans le prix du séjour.
Le personnel est aimable et serviable.
Nous recommandons fortement cet établissement qui sort vraiment de l'ordinaire.

text:
Das Seven Havens ist eine der schönsten Unterkünfte, in der ich jemals war. Die Residenz, mit aktuell nur 3 Zimmern, liegt rund 2 km vom Sandstrand entfernt auf einem kleinen Hügel. Der Ausblick ist einfach fantastisch!! 

Unser super sauberes Zimmer erstreckte sich über 2 Etagen. Auch vom Bett aus hat man diesen wunderbaren Ausblick. Das Personal ist sehr herzlich und erfüllt alle Wünsche. Selbst zum Strand wird man gebracht und wieder abgeholt. Die Sonnenuntergänge am Pool sind einfach ein Traum. Abends kam zudem eine Affenfamilie auf dem Weg in ihr Nachtquartier vorbei. 

Das Frühstück wird frisch zubereitet und auf der Terrasse serviert. Wir haben uns im Seven Haven sehr, sehr wohl gefühlt und können diese Unterkunft uneingeschränkt empfehlen!
title: Mega!!!

Dear sir/madame
Thank you very much for your kind and positive review. We always try hard and our best to provide comfortable and enjoyable holiday for our guests. We hope one day we can welcoming you back again in Seven Havens residence

text:
Super hôtel vraiment, l'impression d'être vip dans ce petit eden au milieu de la jungle avec seulement 3 chambres (une petite villa en plus est en construction pour l'an prochain sûrement) 
La chambre avec vue sur la mer est top, la piscine à débordement avec vue sur la mer  vraiment jolie, le personnel aux petits soins, la manager encore plus. Sont compris dans votre chambre un service pour vous emmener à la plage qui est à 10 minutes plus bas si vous choisissez d'y aller à pied. Elle vous conseille de bons restaurants où là encore un chauffeur vous emmène et vous récupère. J'ai demandé une chose spéciale pour l'anniversaire de mon copain et franchement c'était super, à manger pour 4 alors que nous étions 2 😉 que des produits frais au barbecue! Et elle nous a offert une bouteille de vin pour l'occasion.
Nous avons pris nos lunchs à la résidence et c'est vraiment de la nourriture de qualité.
El prime, un safari le soir et parfois la journée, en effet avec les fortes chaleurs des singes viennent boire dans la piscine et jouent avec les fauteuils de la terrasse, nous pouvions tout voir de notre chambre!
Si vous en avez peur vous sonnez et le staff les fait fuire. 
Des grenouilles et crapauds viennent sur la terrasse la nuit tombée et quelques geckos parfois entrent dans la chambre sans jamais vous approchez. Franchement cela ne nous a pas dérangez nous nous sommes même sentis privilégiés d'être dans ce morceau de nature et de pouvoir vivre avec elle(même si à la base j'ai plutôt peur des petites bêtes 😅)
Foncez!
title: Superbe

text:
Wir hatten eine wundervolle Zeit im Seven Havens. Der Ausblick war atemberaubend! Ich habe jede Sekunde genossen! Die Gastgeberfamilie war sehr sehr freundlich und aufmerksam. Wir haben uns wie ein Teil der Familie gefühlt. Das Design ist für Lombok einzigartig! Ich kann jedem nur empfehlen hier zu übernachten. Es war die beste Zeit auf unserer Reise! Die Sonnenuntergänge sind unglaublich schön!

@our hosts: thank you very much for the warm welcome! We will definitely return!

text: Wir hatten unglaublich schöne 3 Tage im Seven Havens. Ich kann jedem nur ans Herz legen diesen magischen Ort zu besuchen. Wir wurden so herzlich aufgenommen, es war fabelhaft. Super leckeres Essen, ein wunderschönes Zimmer mit sensationellem Ausblick und das Highlight ganz sicher das freundliche und immer sehr hilfsbereite Personal. Just amazing!!!!! Please stay here
title: Sechs von fünf Punkten

text:
Seven Havens er noe helt for seg selv. På en liten topp rundt 1 km fra Selong Belanak-stranden finner du er bittelite hotell, men med et enormt hjerte og full av sjel. Hotellet er bygd primært av gjenbruksmaterialer og andre miljøvennlige materialer som bambus. Det har kun 3 rom i tillegg til fellesområdet, hvor du blant annet finner er særdeles spektakulært infinity-pool. Bassenget har en ubeskrivelig utsikt over Selong Belanak, og nærmest henger ut av fjellsiden - fra ytre kant og ned til bakken er det i hvert fall 5-6 meter.

Servicen er ekstremt bra, og især driftslederen (Julia) gjør sitt ytterste for at du skal få et fantastisk opphold. En enkel frokost er inkludert, og den serveres akkurat når det måtte passe deg. Stedet har egen kokk, så både lunsj og middag kan bestilles på stedet. Det benyttes ingen skreven meny, i stedet kan man komme med ønsker, alternativt få forslag. Prisene både på lunsj og middag var absolutt rimelige. Det er ingen kjøleskap eller minibar på rommene, men i fellesområdet er det et normalt stort kjøleskap til fri benyttelse. Her er det også mulig forsyne seg av øl og brus, mot en absolutt grei pris. Vær oppmerksom på at øvrig alkohol ikke finnes tilgjengelig på hotellet, men kan (så vidt vi forsto) medbringes selv. Hotellet ligger i "jungelen". Aper så vi fra hotellet hver dag, og enkelte ganger kom noen av de opp på hotellområdet også. Av klimaprosjekt finnes det også en del insekter der. Det kan være en god ide ikke ha dører åpne om om kvelden, især ikke om du har på lys inne.

Selong Belanak er et utrolig nydelig sted, med en utrolig fantastisk strand. Det er imidlertid også svært rolig der, og bortsett fra å nyte stranden om dagen, og utsikten og roen forøvrig er det lite å gjøre der. Drosjer finnes det ikke, men hotellet har egen transportordning. Det er gratis transport innen Selong Belanak samt t/r LOP, og forøvrig fornuftige priser på transport til øvrige deler av Lombok. I tillegg har de scootere tilgjengelig for utlån. Laut Biru som ligger knappe 10 minutters gange unna har både en brukbar restaurant og en god SPA tilgjengelig. I tillegg anbefales middag, eventuelt kun cocktails, på Aura. Aura ligger rundt 15 minutter i bil unna hotellet.

Seven Havens ligner intet du har sett før. Et opphold her vil du neppe glemme med det første. Anbefales på det sterkeste.
title: WOW!

text:
Genial du début à la fin 
Petit plaisir de notre séjour, cette belle villa entre amis partagée pour 4 avec chauffeur, cuisinier, une hôtesse qui s'occupe de tout et essaye de faire en sorte que tout soit au mieux et possible. 
Nous avons demandé un cours de cuisine sur place dans ce cadre magnifique 
Piscine fabuleuse, une vue sur la baie de selong blanak à couper le souffle ! 
Un petit séjour inoubliable !
title: Absolument fabuleux

text: Bellissime camere la nostra aveva una vista incredibile.. il residence è composto solo da 3 unità ed è nuovissimo.. un luogo esclusivo con una stupenda piscina infinity. . Durante il giorno e la sera si vedono varie scimmiette.. la colazione ottima preparata davanti a voi.. la cucina è ottima.. noi abbiamo pranzato e cenato li in una cornice unica.. il personale in particolare Giulia è disponibilissimo tra le persone più carine e gentili incontrate nel nostro viaggio in indonesia.. sempre pronta ad aiutarvi in qualunque modo.. insomma un soggiorno fantastico sotto tutti i punti di vista..
title: Stupendo

text:
Wir waren 4 Tage, für einen Zwischenstopp, in der Villa und haben die Privatsphäre sehr genossen. Wir haben uns von der Rundreise in Indonesien in der Villa sehr gut erholen können. Julia und ihr Team waren die perfekten Gastgeber und haben uns sehr verwöhnt. Wir gehen definitiv wieder hin. 
Wir können die Seven Haven Residence nur allen empfehlen.
title: Perfekter Urlaub

text: Magnifique villa qui nous a été conseillée par des amis. Un des meilleurs spot en Indonesie pour passer des vacances de rêve au calme et dans le luxe. Personel aux petits soins, prestations de standing. A cela s'ajoute une vue magnifique sur les colines descendants sur la mer turquoise. Nous avons aimé l'architecture atypique ainsi que le mobilier choisi avec soin.
title: Le lieu parfait

owner_response.text: Thank you very much for your kind review, always a great pleasure to know that our guests are happy with the accommodation and the whole experience. We hope that you will come back again to Seven Havens with your lovely family.
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
Un endroit magique en face de la mer et des collines de la côte de Lombok. Une véritable trouvaille que je ne manquerai pas d'en parler à mes amis tant j'ai trouvé le lieu magique en particulier les levers et couchés de soleil ou les couleurs sur la nature sont aucune mesure.
La piscine débordante est très agréable, la terrasse zen avec en plus, un personnel au petit soin qui peuvent même vous préparer un plat indonésien.
La villa, monté sur pilotis qu'on peut voir de la mer est à quelques minutes de la plage Selong Belanak qui est le paradis des surfeurs! 
La maison semble assez récente car elle est très propre et les mobilier semble neuf!
Une super adresse!
title: Le paradis sur terre en Famille, dans cette villa!!!

owner_response.text: Thank you so much for your kind words, you and your family were great guests at our residence and we are very please to hear that you enjoy your time with us. Again, thank you for your kindness and hope to see you and family again in Seven Havens Residence.
